p: Older PLWH may not be the only members of the HIV seropositive population at risk for the negative health sequelae of COVID-19. Given recent developments that have shown the vulnerability of those ages 18–49 to COVID-19 [ 33], younger PLWH may also be at heightened risk for mortality due to COVID-19 complications. Such risk is predicated on the fact that PLWH under age 50 are both less likely to be diagnosed (and in effect more likely to be immunocompromised) and also less likely to access and be retained in care, yielding viral suppression of a mere 37% on those age 25–34 [ 34].
